column4: hi, in upgrading my computer to jaunty the networking broke: ifconfig only finds the loopback interface
obviously I cant apt-get install -f to depants it; can anybody help me diagnose and fix the problem?
you might try restarting with the previus kernel .. to see if that fixes anything
you rock, going back to the previous kernel fixed it, thanks
doing that may or may not break other things
well, as long as it fixes networking...
you still have a broken system - and it may take a little figuring out to get you back to golden

can you give me a clue on how to start diagnosing it? It is testimony to ubuntu's goodness that I have been using it for four years now, but it has mostly worked till now, so I don't even know where to start poking
firstly you can search on ubuntuforums.org for people having the same errors as you... 2 google search ubuntu jaunty networking broken on upgrade
except that the problem now is not broken networking, but broken apt
apt is broken because apt was upgraded - using the broken(new) kernel apt would work
tritium: apt/dpkg will not while the intrepid kernel is loaded... must fix jaunty kernel for networking or apt to work
tritium: note that I am using kernel 2.6.27.14 now and jaunty kernel is 2.6.28.12 (but my networking does not work under jaunty kernel)
why does dpkg require the jaunty kernel?
thanks for the advice, and I am doing it just to give it a try, but surely the problem is in the databases and not in the dpkg-kernel interaction?
